channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Some in the U.S. farm industry are alarmed by Trump's embrace of RFK Jr. and tariffs
item.description: President-elect Trump won landslide support in much of farm country, but his embrace of Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his plan for a tariff fight with China alarms many farmers and agriculture experts.
item.content:encoded:
President-elect Trump won landslide support in much of farm country, but his embrace of Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his plan for a tariff fight with China alarms many farmers and agriculture experts.

(Image credit: Rebecca Noble)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Trump picks loyalists for top jobs, testing loyalty of Senate GOP
item.description: Nominees for several key Cabinet posts in the new administration of President-elect Trump caught officials in Washington off guard and ignited a firestorm of criticism — not all of it from Democrats.
item.content:encoded:
Nominees for several key Cabinet posts in the new administration of President-elect Trump caught officials in Washington off guard and ignited a firestorm of criticism — not all of it from Democrats.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Ron Elving

item.title: Local news is in crisis. This paper has a $150 million plan
item.description: Nearly two years ago, the owners of Atlanta's leading newspaper hired former CNN executive Andrew Morse to reverse its steep decline. He's laid out a grand vision.
item.content:encoded:
Nearly two years ago, the owners of Atlanta's leading newspaper hired former CNN executive Andrew Morse to reverse its steep decline. He's laid out a grand vision.

(Image credit: Paras Griffin)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Erykah Badu likes chasing unreachable goals. Here's why
item.description: Erykah Badu opens up on Wild Card about wanting to live in a space shuttle, how music is the undertone to her life, and whether there's more to reality than we can see or touch.
item.content:encoded:
Erykah Badu opens up on Wild Card about wanting to live in a space shuttle, how music is the undertone to her life, and whether there's more to reality than we can see or touch.

(Image credit: Ron Jenkins)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: The USPS will honor Betty White with her own stamp in 2025
item.description: Having received hundreds to thousands of fan mail each week, it's only fitting to honor White with a postage stamp.
item.content:encoded:
Having received hundreds to thousands of fan mail each week, it's only fitting to honor White with a postage stamp.

(Image credit: U.S. Postal Service)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Russia launches massive attack on Ukraine's energy infrastructure, Zelenskyy says
item.description: Russia on Sunday launched a massive drone and missile attack on Ukraine, described by officials as the largest over the past months, targeting energy infrastructure and killing civilians.
item.content:encoded:
Russia on Sunday launched a massive drone and missile attack on Ukraine, described by officials as the largest over the past months, targeting energy infrastructure and killing civilians.

(Image credit: Denes Erdos)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Scientists find a 35,000-year-old saber-toothed kitten in the Siberian permafrost
item.description: The kitten, which was found in Russia's northeastern Sakha Republic, still had fur and whiskers when it was discovered.
item.content:encoded:
The kitten, which was found in Russia's northeastern Sakha Republic, still had fur and whiskers when it was discovered.

(Image credit: Lopatin et al. Scientific Reports)
item.dc:creator: Mansee Khurana

item.title: Biden and Xi take a first step to limit AI and nuclear decisions at their last meeting
item.description: The leaders agreed that humans should control decisions to use nuclear weapons — not AI. And they talked about the importance of stability during the transition to a new U.S. administration.
item.content:encoded:
The leaders agreed that humans should control decisions to use nuclear weapons — not AI. And they talked about the importance of stability during the transition to a new U.S. administration.

(Image credit: Leah Millis)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: Trump announces oil executive Chris Wright as his pick for energy secretary
item.description: Trump announced Chris Wright, the CEO of oil and natural gas fracking services company Liberty Energy, as his pick for energy secretary.
item.content:encoded:
Trump announced Chris Wright, the CEO of oil and natural gas fracking services company Liberty Energy, as his pick for energy secretary.

(Image credit: Alastair Pike)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: A derogatory term for Native women will be removed from place names across California
item.description: The word "squaw" was declared derogatory by the Department of Interior in 2021. Since then, hundreds of geographic features have been renamed with input from local tribes and Indigenous communities.
item.content:encoded:
The word "squaw" was declared derogatory by the Department of Interior in 2021. Since then, hundreds of geographic features have been renamed with input from local tribes and Indigenous communities.

(Image credit: Max Whittaker)
item.dc:creator: Mansee Khurana
